definition: delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate
soldiers/a force/an army/weapons/arms/military/warlike/CL:個|个[ge4]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: What he said is just to delay the time.
sentences.chinese: 他的託詞只是緩兵之計。

sentences.english: Most observers agree that temporary foreign teachers are not a permanent solution.
sentences.chinese: 許多專家認爲聘請外籍教師的辦法只是一個緩兵之計。
他的託辭只是緩兵之計。

sentences.english: You are slow-walking me, aren't you?
sentences.chinese: 這不過是你的緩兵之計吧？

definition: equivocal/ambiguous
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]

lit. secretly crossing the Wei River 渭河[Wei4 He2] at Chencang (idiom, refers to a stratagem used by Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] in 206 BC against Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3] of Chu)/fig. to feign one thing while doing another/to cheat under cover of a diversion
to obstruct/to impede
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
(idiom) to lose one's head/to panic/to go to pieces
to whisper to one another's ear
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
hunger strike
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: to have no other choice/to be the last resort
pinyin: bu4 de2 yi3 er2 wei2 zhi1

definition: stupid/stubborn/pigheaded
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
